intro: Lasianthus rhizophyllus, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific habitats. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique adaptations to rocky environments. The plant has small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its root system is highly developed to anchor it in crevices and absorb nutrients from the limited soil. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
